label: Seat Selection & Upsell
description: Dynamic seat pricing with personalized recommendations delivering 30-50% ancillary revenue increase through intelligent premium seat merchandising and willingness-to-pay optimization.

traditional.workflow: 1. Airline charges static fees for seat selection: $15 aisle, $25 extra legroom, $50 exit row. 2. Same price for all customers regardless of route, demand, or customer value. 3. Generic seat map shown at checkout with no personalization. 4. Customer must click each seat to see price - tedious discovery. 5. 15-25% seat fee attachment rate due to poor merchandising.
constraints: Static pricing leaves money on table (high demand routes underpriced)
No personalization - business traveler sees same options as leisure
Poor UX - customer must click 30+ seats to compare prices
15-25% attach rate due to generic merchandising
High-value customers not offered premium options proactively
No willingness-to-pay optimization

agentic.workflow: 1. Dynamic Seat Pricing Agent adjusts prices by demand: exit row $50 on leisure route, $80 on business route with high load factor. 2. Personalization Engine recommends seats based on profile: tall customer gets extra legroom offer, family gets seats together, business traveler sees premium economy upgrade. 3. Visual Merchandising highlights best-value options: 'Recommended: Extra legroom for $35 (most popular for 6+ hour flights)'. 4. Willingness-to-Pay Model tests price sensitivity: show $60 to high-value customer, $40 to price-sensitive. 5. Upsell Path Agent suggests seat upgrade after bag fee purchase: 'Add extra legroom for only $20 more'.
dataSources: Seat inventory and availability by cabin
Historical seat purchase patterns by route
Customer profile (height, family size, tier status)
Customer price sensitivity and past purchases
A/B test results for pricing and presentation
benefits: Dynamic pricing captures 20-30% more revenue on high-demand

quickWins: Implement route-based dynamic pricing for premium seats
Add personalized seat recommendations at checkout

label: Baggage Fee Management
description: Predictive baggage needs with smart bundling increasing bag fee revenue 25-40% through pre-purchase incentives and usage prediction.

traditional.workflow: 1. Customer books flight without purchasing baggage allowance. 2. Customer arrives at airport and pays bag fee at check-in ($35 for first bag). 3. Static pricing regardless of route, season, or customer. 4. Customer frustrated by unexpected fee and airport rush. 5. 40-50% of bag fees collected at airport (lower margin, worse experience).
constraints: 40-50% bag fees paid at airport (operational cost, customer friction)
Static pricing doesn't optimize revenue
No incentive for pre-purchase (same price at airport)
Customer surprised by fees at check-in (poor experience)
No predictive modeling of bag needs
Missed bundling opportunities (seat + bag discounts)

agentic.workflow: 1. Baggage Prediction Agent analyzes trip: 7-day vacation to Hawaii = 90% chance of checked bag, 2-day business trip = 10% chance. 2. Pre-Purchase Incentive Agent offers discount: 'Add checked bag now for $25 (save $10 vs $35 at airport)'. 3. Bundling Engine creates packages: 'Seat + Bag Bundle: Extra legroom + checked bag for $50 (save $15)'. 4. Dynamic Pricing adjusts bag fees by route demand and seasonality. 5. Reminder Agent sends pre-flight notifications: 'Flying tomorrow - add bag for $28 (airport price $35)' with one-tap purchase.
benefits: Dynamic pricing optimizes revenue by route/season

quickWins: Offer $5-10 pre-purchase discount vs airport price

label: In-Flight Services & Upgrades
description: Personalized in-flight merchandising with pre-order and real-time offers delivering 40-70% increase in onboard revenue through targeted food, beverage, and WiFi sales.

traditional.workflow: 1. Flight attendant pushes cart down aisle offering snacks and drinks. 2. Limited inventory often runs out by rear of aircraft. 3. Passengers unaware of menu options before boarding. 4. Cash/credit card transactions slow down service. 5. 15-25% of passengers purchase something, avg transaction $8-12.
constraints: Cart service slow and disruptive (interrupts work, sleep)
Inventory stockouts frustrate customers in rear cabin
No pre-order or personalization
Payment friction (credit card readers, cash handling)
15-25% attach rate due to passive merchandising
No upsell or cross-sell recommendations

agentic.workflow: 1. Pre-Order Agent sends notification 24 hours before flight: 'Pre-order lunch and WiFi for your 6pm flight - save 15% and skip the cart'. 2. Personalization Engine recommends items: vegan meal for vegetarian customer, coffee for morning flight, cocktail for evening leisure flight. 3. In-Flight Upsell Agent sends targeted offers via seatback screen: 'Upgrade to premium WiFi for $5 more (streaming video)'. 4. Digital Payment enables one-tap purchases via app (linked to booking payment). 5. Inventory Optimization ensures popular items stocked based on passenger profiles.
dataSources: Customer dietary preferences and past purchases
Flight timing and duration (breakfast vs dinner service)
WiFi usage patterns and device types
benefits: 40-70% onboard revenue increase through personalization and pre-order
Pre-order reduces crew workload and speeds service

quickWins: Launch pre-order for food and WiFi with 15% discount
prerequisites: Mobile app or web pre-order capability

label: Travel Insurance & Protection
description: Risk-based insurance recommendations with dynamic pricing increasing insurance attachment 35-60% through contextual offers and AI-driven risk assessment.

traditional.workflow: 1. Generic insurance offer shown at checkout: '$49 trip protection for cancellations and medical'. 2. Same price and coverage for all trips regardless of risk or value. 3. Buried in checkout flow - easy to skip. 4. No risk assessment or personalized recommendation. 5. 8-12% attachment rate with minimal customer understanding of value.
constraints: Generic offer lacks relevance (same for $200 vs $5000 trip)
Static pricing doesn't reflect risk (hurricane season, COVID)
8-12% attach rate due to poor merchandising
Customers don't understand coverage (skip by default)
No personalization by risk factors (age, destination, health)
Missed high-value opportunities (expensive trips, high-risk destinations)

agentic.workflow: 1. Risk Assessment Agent analyzes trip: $8000 safari to Kenya booked 6 months out = high cancellation risk, medical coverage critical. 2. Dynamic Pricing adjusts insurance premium based on risk factors: trip cost, destination health risk, customer age, booking lead time. 3. Personalized Recommendation highlights relevant coverage: 'Kenya requires yellow fever vaccination - medical coverage protects you up to $100K'. 4. Contextual Messaging emphasizes value: 'Protect your $8000 investment for just $185 (2.3% of trip cost)'. 5. Tiered Options present basic/standard/premium coverage for customer choice.
dataSources: Booking lead time and cancellation likelihood
Historical claim data by route and season
Insurance conversion rates by offer type
benefits: Dynamic pricing optimizes revenue and coverage
Higher margin on personalized vs generic policies

quickWins: Implement trip value-based insurance pricing (2-3% of cost)
Add destination risk messaging for high-risk locations

label: Destination Activities & Experiences
description: AI-curated tour and activity recommendations with seamless booking integration delivering 15-25% ancillary revenue increase through personalized destination merchandising.

traditional.workflow: 1. Travel booking site shows generic 'Things to do in Paris' page with top 10 tourist attractions. 2. Customer clicks through to third-party tour operator to book Eiffel Tower tickets. 3. Booking happens on external site - airline/hotel loses commission and customer relationship. 4. No personalization (family with kids sees same options as couple). 5. 5-8% of customers book activities, minimal revenue capture.
constraints: Generic recommendations not personalized to interests
5-8% activity booking rate due to poor relevance
Leakage to third-party sites (lost commission revenue)
Activities not integrated with flight/hotel itinerary
No timing optimization (booked activity conflicts with flight)
Limited inventory (only major tourist attractions)

agentic.workflow: 1. Activity Recommendation Agent analyzes customer: family with kids gets 'Paris Kid-Friendly: Disneyland, Science Museum, Luxembourg Gardens', couple gets 'Romantic Paris: Seine dinner cruise, Louvre after-hours, cooking class'. 2. Itinerary Integration ensures activities align with flight times and hotel location. 3. Inventory Agent accesses 200+ activities via Viator, GetYourGuide APIs with real-time availability. 4. Dynamic Bundling offers packages: 'Book 3 activities and save 15%'. 5. One-Click Booking enables seamless purchase with confirmation added to trip itinerary.
benefits: 15-25% ancillary revenue increase from activity bookings
Seamless booking keeps customer in ecosystem (higher commission)

quickWins: Integrate Viator API for top 20 destinations
Add personalized activity recommendations on confirmation page

label: Car Rental & Ground Transportation
description: Integrated ground transport booking with intelligent modal recommendations delivering 20-35% attachment increase through contextual offers and multi-modal optimization.

traditional.workflow: 1. Customer books flight, then separately visits Hertz.com to rent car. 2. Generic car rental offer shown: 'Rent a car from $39/day'. 3. Customer unaware of alternatives (Uber, public transit, hotel shuttle). 4. No bundling discount with flight booking. 5. 12-18% of customers book car rental, often paying higher rates than bundled offers.
constraints: Separate booking on car rental site (no bundling discount)
Generic offer not personalized to trip (business vs leisure)
12-18% attach rate due to poor integration
No multi-modal comparison (car vs Uber vs transit)
Customer may not need car for entire trip (waste)
Missed commission revenue from external bookings

agentic.workflow: 1. Modal Recommendation Agent analyzes trip: Vegas strip hotel with nearby convention center = 'Public transit + Uber recommended, save $200 vs rental'. Beach resort in Maui = 'Car rental essential for exploring island'. 2. Bundling Engine offers integrated discount: 'Add car rental now for $35/day (save 15% vs booking separately)'. 3. Multi-Modal Agent presents alternatives with cost comparison: car $45/day, Uber estimate $60/day, hotel shuttle free. 4. Duration Optimizer suggests partial rental: 'Rent for days 3-7 only (sightseeing days), use hotel shuttle days 1-2'. 5. One-Click Booking adds rental to trip itinerary with pickup/return aligned to flight times.
benefits: Partial rentals optimize cost for customer

quickWins: Integrate car rental with 10-15% bundle discount
Add rideshare cost estimates for comparison

label: Dynamic Ancillary Pricing
description: Real-time price optimization across all ancillaries with demand-based adjustments delivering 25-45% revenue increase through sophisticated yield management.

traditional.workflow: 1. Airline sets static ancillary prices annually: seat selection $25, bag fee $35, WiFi $12. 2. Same prices regardless of route, season, demand, or customer. 3. High-demand routes leave revenue on table (would pay $40 for premium seat). 4. Low-demand routes have poor attach (price too high for price-sensitive customers). 5. Quarterly pricing reviews with manual adjustments.
constraints: Static pricing misses 20-40% revenue opportunity
Same price for Hawaii vacation (high willingness-to-pay) vs short regional flight
No real-time response to demand or competitive changes
Quarterly reviews mean stale pricing 11 months per year
Can't test price sensitivity (no A/B testing)
Leaves money on table in peak demand, loses sales in low demand

agentic.workflow: 1. Dynamic Pricing Engine adjusts ancillary prices real-time based on: route, day of week, season, load factor, days to departure, customer segment. 2. Demand Signal Agent monitors booking velocity and inventory levels to optimize pricing. 3. Willingness-to-Pay Model sets customer-specific prices: business traveler sees WiFi $18, leisure customer sees $10. 4. Competitive Monitoring tracks rival pricing and adjusts to maintain competitiveness. 5. A/B Testing Engine continuously experiments with pricing to find optimal price points by segment.
dataSources: Real-time booking and load factor data
Historical ancillary purchase patterns by route
Days to departure and urgency signals
A/B test results and price elasticity models
benefits: Real-time pricing vs quarterly static updates
Capture high willingness-to-pay in premium scenarios
Stimulate demand with lower prices in off-peak

quickWins: Implement route-based seat pricing (leisure vs business routes)
